intro: Psychotria grandistipulata, commonly known as the large-leaved Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It produces small, red berries that are often consumed by birds, aiding in seed dispersal. Psychotria grandistipulata is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests.
